intro: Asplenium × reuteri nothosubsp. aprutianum, commonly known as the Aprutian shield fern, is a hybrid species within the genus Asplenium, characterized by its distinctive, shield-shaped fronds. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe, particularly in Italy and parts of the Balkans. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky slopes. Its fronds are usually dark green with a leathery texture and possess a unique, compact growth habit. This nothosubspecies is of interest to botanists due to its hybrid origin and limited distribution.
